channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Panjshir - the valley trying to hold off the Taliban
item.description: The last bastion of resistance is still holding out just north-east of the capital, Kabul.

item.title: Climate-above-all plea by US fails to stir China
item.description: Envoy John Kerry's 'it's more important than politics' appeal falls on deaf ears.

item.title: Syed Ali Shah Geelani: The man who fought for Kashmir’s freedom
item.description: Syed Ali Shah Geelani believed India should not rule the region and never changed his stand.

item.title: China's media cracks down on 'effeminate' styles
item.description: The media regulator says it will shun "vulgar influencers" while casting a spotlight on stars' pay.

item.title: China steps in to regulate brutal '996' work culture
item.description: Workers in China are fed up with the brutal 12-hour work days once seen as a key driver of success.

item.title: Afghan evacuee boy who ate poisonous mushrooms dies in Poland
item.description: The five year old ate the mushrooms at a refugee centre near Warsaw after his evacuation from Kabul.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Afghanistan: Facebook says it helped people flee, including staff
item.description: The flight arrived in Mexico City on Wednesday, with 175 Afghan citizens on board, including 75 children.

item.title: Beaten and humiliated by Hindu mobs for being a Muslim in India
item.description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have risen in India, with little apparent official condemnation.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Anger after Paralympian is stripped of gold medal for being late
item.description: Muhammad Ziyad Zolkefli won his shot put event but had his title revoked because he was three minutes late.

item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: North Korea rejects offer of almost three million Covid-19 jabs
item.description: The country asked that the shots offered under the Covax scheme be redirected to harder hit nations.

item.title: Tonga royals deny Australia horse trainer murder link
item.description: It has addressed tabloid allegations that the late king was involved in covering up a 1980s killing.

item.title: Air pollution may reduce life expectancy of Indians by nine years, says study
item.description: Millions in north India face the most extreme levels of air pollution in the world, the report says.

item.title: Japan finds black particles in Moderna vaccine
item.description: It comes less than a week after the country suspended more than a million doses due to contamination.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: Covid threatens Singapore's business hub crown
item.description: The South East Asian country faces opposing pressures over the large number of workers from overseas.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan and leaving dreams behind
item.description: The BBC speaks to Afghans fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan at the Chaman Spin Boldak border.

item.title: Fury as Covid crisis hits Australia's Aboriginal communities
item.description: Indigenous Australians say surging infections in remote areas should have been prevented.

item.title: Left behind in Afghanistan: If I can’t get out, I’ll die
item.description: An Afghan who had authorisation to fly to the UK speaks to the BBC about his struggle to escape.
